289

Growing alone from a small firmly attached stump or root ball on well compared soil on trail near the edge of a high, open, shady oak/hickory woodland.

- Cap: concentric zones of black, dark brown, and light brown with outer new growth white. Sessile.
- Hymenium: white and lumpy. Full of trail debris/duff fused in tissue. Bruising gray.
- KOH: yellow on hymenium.
- Ammonia: light yellow on hymenium.
- Smell: strong, sweet
- Taste: strong, bitter.
